customresponse.p: You may take the scale drawn below as accurate

text.h4: Rank the maximum orbital speeds of the orbits shown above from greatest to least. If you believe that they cannot all be ranked, select from one of the reasons below and put that into the bottom row (be sure to leave the top row blank).
Rank the maximum orbital speeds of the orbits shown above from greatest to least.
text.p: To rank them: use the letters A-F and the symbols = and >. For example, A = B > C means "A and B have the same max speeds, and they both have a greater max speed than C." If you believe that they cannot all be ranked, select from one of the reasons below and put the corresponding reason number into the bottom row (be sure to leave the top row blank).

Reason 1: Information about the masses of the objects is needed to compare the speeds.
Reason 2: Information about distances in the vertical direction is needed in order to compare the speeds.
Reason 3: The maximum speed is proportional to the speed at the apoapsis which is unknown, therefore the ranking is not possible.

customresponse.answer:
correct_answer = [ {'draggables': ['D'],'targets': ['item1'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['C'],'targets': ['item2'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['B'],'targets': ['item3'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['A'],'targets': ['item4'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['F'],'targets': ['item5'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['E'],'targets': ['item6'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['gt'],'targets': ['sign1','sign2','sign3','sign4','sign5'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}]
if draganddrop.grade(submission[0], correct_answer): correct = ['correct'] else: correct = ['incorrect']
